reviews.text: An exceptional hotel, everything you need for a great holiday. Clean, friendly and great food. If you love Greek Cuisine then this it the hotel for you.
reviews.title: Exceedingly Good.

reviews.text: We stayed the 2nd 2 weeks of May, it was quite, busy at the weekends, during this period there is a local holiday. It accommodates a multi national clientèle, which is nice as you get to know others for different parts of the world. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff, the try and please.
reviews.title: A family run middle size hotel, worth a visit!

reviews.text: The Rooms are spacious, a lift to each floor. The only down side is there are many stairs. Not good for those with disabilities. Also a busy road to cross to get to the Village of Gouvia. (The is a crossing but remember the traffic do not always give way to pedestrians. But, the pluses out number the negatives here. It really is worth a visit, but stay on half board and you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Cannot wait to go again

reviews.text: We really did get more than we paid for, a great bargain and a great holiday.
reviews.title: the best we have found in corfu
the hotel is good the pool nice
reviews.text: This family run hotel, has been in operation for over 30 years, most of the bedrooms have recently been renovated, the sarounding areas are always kept spotless and clean. The Restaurant offers continental enriched buffet style breakfast with a variety each day of hot food. The outside Nautica Taverna-Bar offers some light and good value for money snacks and meals for the aftrnoon, with refreshments and lovely cocktails available by the bar, a vast selection of ice-creams on sale, the fresh water swimming pool which operates from 10 am till 19 pm can keep you refreshed, while in between dips you take your sun lounger and find the perfect spot, whether it be around the pool or under some shade by the tree sides. The restaurant at night offers Greek and European selection of buffet style food, with a large variety of deserts and some nice Greek wines on offer. The night bar Nafsika or Kefi offer you a lovely relaxing area on the verandah overlooking the pool (which is light by night) to enjoy the wonderfull cocktails the lovely Voula creates. Weekly entertainment programe available at least three times a week, there's a Greek Night, a Bingo & Quiz night as well as a Duet of Live International Music for your pleasure to either sit and listen or to get up join in and dance.

We found this hotel to be an excellent value. It is a large hotel with extensive ground, huge pool area, big lobby, bar, poolside bar, huge breakfast floor etc. the rooms we were in (we had 2) were good size and recently updated with modern furniture, comfortable beds and were very clean. Breakfast was elaborate on a separate floor. Wi fi was also included but was only available in the lobby, which for us was not convenient. This hotel is frequented by European tourist mostly from nearby countries and from the Greek mainland so not much in the way of English translations. The front desk staff was trying hard and were friendly. The pool area and grounds were huge and beautiful with night activity around and in the bars. We had one of our toilets that did not work at night and apparently there was no maintenance man on duty (a bit odd because it is such a large hotel, I think over 200 rooms) but the clerk gave keys to another close by room to use until morning. When he later was doing his night audit, he forgot which room he gave and called to verify at 3:30 am(?). The manager when contacted apologized and made an adjustment. All in all a very good value for the money and well located in Gouvia a short drive to Corfu Town
reviews.title: Great value and grand hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was very clean and the staff were friendly. A great pool and enough beds for everybody. we could get down there at anytime and be able to still find spare beds. My partner has a nut allergy and was unsure whether the food was all safe to eat but the staff were able to help and discuss what was the food. To get to Corfu town or Dassia the bus stop was just outside the hotel which was really handy.
reviews.title: Great Pool, Very relaxing

reviews.text: I will definitely stay here again
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent price-quality hotel! nice rooms, good food, very friendly, nice pool, good service, very clean... they got all for a relaxing holiday. If you want a party holiday or an adventurous holiday with lots of action you should pick a different hotel. We were very glad we picked this one!!
reviews.title: Sunny Corfu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed on a BB rate. Booked via Thomson. Breakfast was fine, good choice of hot and cold items. Pool was excellent and the gardens were lovely. We were in old part of hotel and had issues with the lock on our door which was reported twice to reception and never dealt with. We did end up renting a safety deposit box for 12 Euros for the week to keep our valuables in so it all worked out. We really weren't that bothered as we were there to relax and probably would have got the box anyway. Staff were nice. We never had dinner in hotel so can't comment on it. If we were to go back to Gouvia we would happily stay here again.
reviews.title: great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a brilliant two weeks in this hotel, we stayed Bed & Breakfast, On first entering our room, we were overwhelmed by the smell of cigarette smoke,mentioned it to reception and informed us that there were no non smoking rooms but they made sure the maids freshened the room the next day. The staff were so friendly and helpful, the pool was always clean and plenty of sunbeds and parasols were available. The bar was always a friendly
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: place to finish the evening, having a laugh with Voula (crazy woman)
reviews.title: Fantastic pool and gardens. Friendly staff. Poor location and avoid if you hate smokers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you eat in Govia, which is an easy 5 mins walk away, then i can recommend Romeos family restaurant were you will get delicious home made Greek food and just a bit further down the road Fresh where you will find homemade ice creams, desserts and the best Irish coffees!!!
reviews.title: Third visit to this great hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location,location.unfortunately if you want to go pleasant outside the hotel you have a noisy, busy and dirty road to deal with. Distant sea views. Local town has plenty of places to eat, though most have identical menus. The Nine muses was the best of the bunch.
reviews.title: generally very good, made so by the staff

reviews.text: The hotel has no non smoking rooms and after two weeks, the smell of stale smoke hit us every time we opened the door. The maid said all rooms were the same. Due to the heat, doors are closed all day. Restaurant had no air con, just Windows open. Avoid rooms near reception, as coaches arrive at all hours and the noise of their reversing warnings disturbs sleep.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel shame about the reception desk staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned having stayed for 7 nights on a bed and breakfast basis as we prefer to eat out in the evenings. All in all a nice hotel and we found it quiet even though there was at times groups of 18 year olds in and around the swimming pool and gardens but to be fair were not that noisy.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the second floor overlooking the swimming pool and the balcony was nice to sit out on once the sun had cast a shadow. The room safe was 12 euros for the week and on arrival you are issued with the air conditioning remote unit.
reviews.title: good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and the breakfast pretty much what you would expect abroad you just walk in select the table you want and get on with it.
reviews.title: Good times

reviews.text: The only issue I had was when I got to the room there was no remote for the tv. I asked at reception and after three visits, two remote controls and a member of housekeeping staff later I was told to inform reception it was a technical problem, I also mentioned it to the holiday rep who told me I should have a television that works and seven days later as we left, no change. I only mention this as whoever checked in after us probably started the process all over again.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again and it was great value for money. There are some great places to eat out in nearby Gouvia.
reviews.title: Good hotel but beware the 18+
